com.pkware.smartcrypt.keymanagement.smartkeys

Interface Smartkey

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSmartkey, ArchiveSmartkey, CommunitySmartkey, ContingencySmartkey, ErrorSmartkey, PrivateSmartkey, SdkSmartkey, TdeSmartkey, UnknownSmartkey

    public interface Smartkey
    Smartkeys are the core building block of Smartcrypt encryption. These contain all the useful information about the underlying cryptographic key.

    Smartkeys are passive object. They do not update in real time, they do not perform complex logic. Smartkeys typically want to be used or monitored in an Observable as that will ensure that your application is working with the latest key information.

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        @Nonnull
String getName()
        Useful for displaying in UIs. May change over time, so not good for programmatic filtering. An empty value indicates that human users should not be aware of this Smartkey.
        Returns:
        may be empty

      • getUrn

        @Nonnull
String getUrn()
        The URN for a Smartkey will never change.
        Returns:
        A globally unique identifier for this Smartkey

      • getKey

        @Nonnull
SecretKey getKey()
                   throws MetaClientException
        Returns:
        the AES key matching the current getRevision()
        Throws:
        MetaClientException - if not allowed to encrypt using this key
        See Also:
        canEncrypt()

      • getRevision

        int getRevision()
        Returns:
        revision of the highest AES key this Smartkey manages

      • getFeatures

        @Nonnull
List<Feature> getFeatures()
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable; perform a copy if you need to change the list. May be empty.

      • getParticipants

        @Nonnull
List<KnownUser> getParticipants()
        Returns:
        Unmodifiable; perform a copy if you need to change the list. May be empty.

      • canManage

        boolean canManage()
        Returns:
        true if this user is allowed to modify this smartkey. If false, attempts at modification will result in errors.

      • canEncrypt

        boolean canEncrypt()
        Returns:
        true if this user is allowed to encrypt using this smartkey. If false, attempts to retrieve the encryption key will throw an exception.

      • canDecrypt

        boolean canDecrypt()
        Returns:
        true if this user is allowed to decrypt using this smartkey. If false, attempts to retrieve the decryption key with throw an exception.

      • getKeyForDecryption

        @Nullable
SecretKey getKeyForDecryption(int revision)
                                 throws MetaClientException
        Returns:
        null if no key is available for the given revision
        Throws:
        MetaClientException - if this key is not allowed to be used for decryption
        See Also:
        canDecrypt()
